question:
Who among the following is known as ‘Captain Cool’ in Indian Cricket?
[SSC CGL 2024 T-1]
solution:
Correct Answer: Mahendra Singh Dhoni

Explanation: Mahendra Singh Dhoni (MS Dhoni) is popularly known as ‘Captain Cool’ due to his calm and composed demeanor on the field, even in high-pressure situations. Under his captaincy, India won major international titles, including the 2007 T20 World Cup, 2011 ODI World Cup, and 2013 Champions Trophy .

Other options:

Virat Kohli: Known for his aggressive captaincy and batting prowess.

Sachin Tendulkar: Referred to as the "God of Cricket."

Kapil Dev: Led India to victory in the 1983 Cricket World Cup .

question:
Which of the following countries will host the ICC men’s Cricket World Cup in the year 2031?
[SSC CGL 2024 T-1]
solution:
Correct Answer: India and Bangladesh

Explanation: The ICC Men's Cricket World Cup in 2031 will be co-hosted by India and Bangladesh .

Other options:

India and Sri Lanka: They are scheduled to co-host the Men's T20 World Cup in 2026 . citeturn0search0

Sri Lanka and Pakistan: There are no current plans for these countries to co-host a major ICC event in the 2024-2031 cycle.

Sri Lanka and Bangladesh: Similarly, there are no scheduled joint hosting arrangements for these nations during this period.

question:
What is the height of the stump from the ground in cricket?
[SSC CPO 2024 T-1]
solution:
Correct Answer: 28 inches

Explanation:

In cricket, the stumps are 28 inches tall from the ground. These stumps are part of the wickets, consisting of three vertical posts. They support the two bails placed across their top.

question:
Who is the highest run scorer in an over in a test match cricket?
[SSC CPO 2024 T-1]
solution:
Correct Answer: Brian Lara

Explanation: -

Brian Lara holds the record for the highest number of runs scored in a single over in a Test match. He scored 28 runs off a single over against South AfricanbowlerRobin Peterson in 2003.

question:
In which year will India organise the ICC Men’s One-Day International World Cup Cricket?
[SSC CPO 2024 T-1]
solution:
Correct Answer: 2031

Explanation:
India is set to co-host the ICC Men’s One-Day International (ODI) World Cup in the year 2031 along with Bangladesh, as per the ICC’s Future Tour Program (FTP) for global cricket events.

question:
In which year was the first time Cricket World Cup held in India?
[SSC SP-12 2024 T-1]
solution:
The correct answer is 1987 .

Explanation: - The 1987 Cricket World Cup was the first time Cricket World Cup held in India . It was co-hosted by India and Pakistan . This tournament marked the fourth edition of the Cricket World Cup, and it was the first time the tournament was held outside of England.

India, along with Pakistan, played a significant role in hosting the event, and it was a landmark moment for Indian cricket. The final was played at the Eden Gardens in Kolkata, where Australia defeated England to win their first-ever World Cup.

Other info: - The 1983 Cricket World Cup was hosted by Australia and won by India.

question:
The first edition of Indian Women’s Premier League (cricket) was held in the year _________.
[SSC Steno 2024 T-1]
solution:
The correct answer is "2023".

Explanation:

The first edition of the Indian Women's Premier League (WPL) was held in 2023. This inaugural season of the WPL marked a significant step in women's cricket in India, providing a platform for female cricketers to showcase their talent in a professional league, similar to the Men's Indian Premier League (IPL).

question:
‘Playing It My Way’ is an autobiography of which of the following legendary cricket players?
[SSC Steno 2024 T-1]
solution:
The correct answer is: Sachin Tendulkar

Explanation:

"Playing It My Way" is the autobiography of Sachin Tendulkar, one of the greatest cricketers of all time. The book was published in 2014 and offers insights into his cricketing career, personal experiences, and thoughts on the game.

Other Important Biographies: -

Brian Lara:

"Born to Play: My Life in Cricket" (2014)

Ricky Ponting:

"Ricky Ponting: At the Close of Play" (2008)

Sunil Gavaskar:

"Sunny Days" (1976)

question:
Indian opener Murali Vijay announced his retirement from international cricket in _________.
[SSC Steno 2024 T-1]
solution:
The correct answer is: January 2023

Explanation:

Murali Vijay, the Indian opening batsman, announced his retirement from international cricket in January 2023. He had been a significant player for India in all formats of the game, especially during the early 2010s.

question:
Which of the following numbers best describes the number of white pieces used in chess?
[SSC CGL 2024 T-1]
solution:
Correct Answer: - 16

Explanation: - In a standard game of chess, each player has 16 pieces. For the player using white pieces, this includes:

1 King

1 Queen

2 Rooks

2 Knights

2 Bishops

8 Pawns

Thus, the total number of white pieces is 16 .

question:
In chess, which of the following may only move forward to the unoccupied square immediately in front of it?
[SSC CGL 2024 T-1]
solution:
The correct answer is: b

In chess, the pawn is the only piece that moves forward to the unoccupied square immediately in front of it. Pawns can only move one square forward (except on their first move, when they can move two squares forward) and capture diagonally.

Some common terms related to chess Checkmate, Stalemate, En Passant, Skewer, Gambit.

question:
Which of the following is the first Indian woman Grandmaster in Chess?
[SSC CGL 2024 T-1]
solution:
Correct Answer: S Vijayalakshmi

Explanation: S. Vijayalakshmi became India’s first woman Grandmaster (WGM) in Chess in 2001 . She has won multiple National Women’s Chess Championships and represented India in various international tournaments. Her achievements paved the way for future Indian female chess players.

Other options:

Harika Dronavalli: A strong Indian Grandmaster but not the first woman Grandmaster.

R Vaishali: A talented Indian chess player and sister of GM Praggnanandhaa, but not the first woman Grandmaster.

Tania Sachdev: An International Master and Woman Grandmaster, but not the first from India.

question:
In chess which of the following may move only diagonally?
[SSC CGL 2024 T-1]
solution:
Correct Answer: The Bishop
Explanation: In chess, the bishop moves only diagonally on the board, either forward or backward, and can move any number of squares. Each bishop is restricted to squares of the same color as its starting position throughout the game.

Other options:

The Rook: Moves horizontally or vertically, not diagonally.

The Knight: Moves in an "L" shape and can jump over other pieces.

The Queen: Can move in any direction (horizontally, vertically, or diagonally) for any number of squares.

question:
The 44ᵗʰ Chess Olympiad was organised in which of the following cities?
[SSC Steno 2024 T-1]
solution:
The correct answer is "Chennai" .

Explanation:

The 44th Chess Olympiad was organized in Chennai, India, in 2022 . This prestigious event took place from July 28 to August 10, 2022, and it marked a significant moment as it was the first time that India hosted the Chess Olympiad in over 30 years.

question:
What is the circumference of the International Football Association Board (IFAB) approved football?
[SSC CHSL 2024 T-1]
solution:
The correct answer is: - 68 - 70 cms

Explanation: - According to the International Football Association Board (IFAB), the circumference of a football used in official competitions should be between 68 cm and 70 cm . This is the standard size for a Size 5 football, which is the size used in most adult and professional matches.

question:
Of the football clubs listed below, which is the oldest in India?
[SSC CHSL 2024 T-1]
solution:
The correct answer is: - Calcutta FC

Explanation: - Calcutta FC is the oldest football club in India. It was founded in 1872 in Kolkata (then Calcutta), making it the first football club in the country. The club played a significant role in the early history of Indian football and was one of the pioneers of the sport in India.

question:
What is the colour of the sending off card in football?
[SSC CHSL 2024 T-1]
solution:
The correct answer is: Red

Explanation: - In football (soccer), the red card is issued to a player who has committed a serious foul or offense, leading to their immediate sending off from the field. A player who receives a red card must leave the pitch and cannot continue playing in the match. The red card is shown by the referee to indicate that the player has been disqualified from the game.

question:
Which of the following terms is related to football?
[SSC CGL 2024 T-1]
solution:
Correct Answer: Bicycle Kick

Explanation:
A bicycle kick is an acrobatic move in football (soccer) where a player jumps and kicks the ball backward over their head while in mid-air. It is one of the most spectacular and skillful moves in the game.

Other options:

Third man: This term is used in cricket, referring to a fielding position behind the wicketkeeper on the off side.

Overs: This term is related to cricket, representing a set of six legal deliveries bowled by a bowler.

LBW (Leg Before Wicket): A rule in cricket where a batsman is out if the ball hits their leg before the bat and would have gone on to hit the stumps.

question:
The Dr. B. C. Roy Trophy is an Indian football tournament for:
[SSC SP-12 2024 T-1]
solution:
The correct answer is Under-19 players.

Explanation:- Dr. B. C. Roy Trophy is an Indian football tournament exclusively for under-19 players. It is one of the premier youth football tournaments in India, named after the former Chief Minister of West Bengal, Dr. Bidhan Chandra Roy, who was a great promoter of sports in the country.

question:
Which of the following leagues is related to the game of football?
[SSC SP-12 2024 T-1]
solution:
The correct answer is Indian Super League.

Explanation: - The Indian Super League (ISL) is a professional football league in India, launched in 2014. It is one of the top football leagues in the country and has significantly contributed to the growth of football in India. The league features several top Indian football clubs and international players.

question:
The 23ʳᵈ FIFA World Cup Football will be jointly organised by:
[SSC Steno 2024 T-1]
solution:
Correct Answer: Canada, USA and Mexico

Explanation:

The 23rd FIFA World Cup will be jointly organized by Canada, USA, and Mexico in 2026. This will be the first time that the World Cup will be hosted by three countries. The tournament will also be the first to feature 48 teams, expanding from the usual 32 teams.

question:
The Asian Football Cup is held once in _________.
[SSC Steno 2024 T-1]
solution:
The correct answer is: - 4 years

Explanation:

The Asian Football Cup (also known as the AFC Asian Cup) is held once every 4 years, and it is organized by the Asian Football Confederation (AFC) for national teams in Asia.

question:
In field hockey, ________ occurs when a player pushes the ball and raises it off the ground.
[SSC CHSL 2024 T-1]
solution:
The correct answer is: - flick

Explanation: - In field hockey, a flick occurs when a player pushes the ball and raises it off the ground using a quick, lifting motion of the stick. This technique is often used for shooting at the goal or passing over an opponent's stick. The flick is executed by pushing the ball with the flat side of the stick and then lifting it into the air.

Explanation for other options:

Bully: A bully is a method of starting play after a stoppage or face-off between two players at the center of the field. The players use their sticks to "push" the ball in a contest to gain possession.

Slap: A slap shot is a technique where a player strikes the ball with the edge of the stick in a powerful, sweeping motion. Unlike the flick, the slap shot does not raise the ball off the ground unless it is specifically intended to do so.

Centre pass: A centre pass is used to start or restart play from the center of the field after a goal has been scored. It is a pass that does not involve lifting the ball but rather a push or pass to a teammate

question:
Where is Birsa Munda International Hockey Stadium located?
[SSC CHSL 2024 T-1]
solution:
The correct answer is: Rourkela

Explanation: - The Birsa Munda International Hockey Stadium is located in Rourkela, which is in the state of Odisha . This stadium was inaugurated in 2023 and is one of the most modern hockey stadiums in India. It was built as a part of the preparation for the 2023 FIH Men's Hockey World Cup, which was co-hosted by Bhubaneswar and Rourkela.

question:
In field hockey, in a penalty stroke, an attacker shoots at goal from _____ yards away in a one-on-one confrontation with the goalkeeper.
[SSC CHSL 2024 T-1]
solution:
Correct Answer: 7 yards

Explanation: In field hockey, during a penalty stroke, the attacker takes the shot 7 yards from the goal line in a one-on-one confrontation with the goalkeeper. The player has a single opportunity to score, with the goalkeeper positioned on the goal line.

question:
Where was India’s first hockey club founded?
[SSC CHSL 2024 T-1]
solution:
Correct Answer: Calcutta

Explanation: India's first hockey club, Calcutta Hockey Club, was founded in 1885 in Calcutta (now Kolkata). This club played a significant role in the development and promotion of hockey in India, which later became one of the country’s most successful sports.

question:
Which of the following countries won the first men’s Asian Hockey Championship trophy?
[SSC CGL 2024 T-1]
solution: The correct answer is: - (Option A) India

question:
When was the Indian Hockey Federation established?
[SSC CGL 2024 T-1]
solution:
Correct Answer: 1925

Explanation: The Indian Hockey Federation (IHF) was established in 1925 to govern and promote the sport of hockey in India. The formation of the IHF played a crucial role in the development of hockey as a national sport and in organizing India's participation in international competitions, including the Olympics . The Indian team has a rich history in field hockey, with several Olympic gold medals to its name, and the IHF was pivotal in organizing and managing the sport in the country.

question:
In which year did India make its Olympic debut in hockey?
[SSC CGL 2024 T-1]
solution:
Correct Answer: 1928

Explanation: - India made its Olympic debut in hockey in the 1928 Summer Olympics held in Amsterdam . India won the gold medal in this debut tournament, marking the beginning of a long and successful legacy in Olympic hockey. India dominated the sport for several decades, winning a total of 8 Olympic gold medals in field hockey.

question:
In which year did India win the men's Hockey World Cup?
[SSC Steno 2024 T-1]
solution:
Correct Answer: 1975

Explanation:

India won the Men's Hockey World Cup in 1975 . The tournament was held in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia, and it marked India's first-ever Hockey World Cup victory . The Indian team, led by Maharaj Krishan Kaushik, defeated Pakistan in the final to claim the title, with a score of 2-1 . This victory was a significant achievement for Indian hockey, as it was the first time India had won the prestigious tournament.

question:
Birsa Munda International Hockey Stadium, which is also the largest seated hockey stadium in the world, is situated in which of the following states?
[SSC Steno 2024 T-1]
solution:
The correct answer is: Odisha

Explanation:

The Birsa Munda International Hockey Stadium is located in Rourkela, Odisha . It holds the distinction of being the largest seated hockey stadium in the world, with a capacity to accommodate over 20,000 spectators. It is a state-of-the-art facility and has been a prominent venue for international hockey tournaments.

question:
Which of the following Table Tennis World Championship events was held in India?
[SSC CGL 2024 T-1]
solution:
The correct answer is 19th World Championships, 1952.

Explanation: - The 19th Table Tennis World Championships were held in New Delhi, India, in 1952. This event marked the first time the World Championships were hosted in India. It was an important milestone for the sport in the country and helped raise the profile of table tennis in India.

Why other options are incorrect:

18th World Championships, 1951: This event was held in Paris, France,

20th World Championships, 1953: This event took place in Brussels, Belgium .

17th World Championships, 1950: This event was held in Paris, France,

question:

solution:
Correct Answer: - Manika Batra .

question:
What is the size of a standard table tennis ball?
[SSC CPO 2024 T-1]
solution:
Correct Answer: 40 mm

Explanation:

A standard table tennis ball has a diameter of 40 mm . This size is regulated by the International Table Tennis Federation (ITTF), and it is used in official competitions.

solution:

question: Who was India’s first Test captain after independence, and in which year did he captain the team for the first time?
solution:

  • First captained: 1947-48 tour to Australia

question: Who was the first Indian cricketer to score a triple century in Test cricket, and against which team?
option_3: Sunil Gavaskar, West Indies
solution:

  • Score: 309 runs
  • Against: Pakistan, Multan, 2004

question: Which of the following pairs of cricketer and nickname is INCORRECT?
option_1: Kapil Dev – Haryana Hurricane
option_2: Shoaib Akhtar – Rawalpindi Express
option_3: Rahul Dravid – God of Cricket

question: Which sport uses the terms “Googly”, “Duck”, and “Bouncer”?
solution:
• Googly: Deceptive leg-spin delivery
  • Duck: Batsman getting out without scoring
  • Bouncer: Short-pitched fast ball rising to batsman’s head height

    All are cricket terminologies.

question: Which female footballer became the first Indian to play in the UEFA Women’s Champions League?

Manisha Kalyan:

question: As per FIFA rules, what should be the circumference range of a football ball used in official sanctioned matches?
solution:
The correct answer is: c
  • FIFA Law: Ball circumference for official matches must be between 27–28 inches (68–70 cm).
  • Ensures standard size and fair play internationally.

question: What is the maximum length of the touch line allowed in a football match as per FIFA rules?
solution:
The correct answer is: c

  • Minimum length: 90 m (100 yards)

question: Who is the only Indian woman tennis player to have won a Grand Slam title?

question: The terms “Shuttlecock”, “Smash”, and “Drop” are used in which sport?

question: Which of the following events is NOT included in Women’s Heptathlon?
solution:
The correct answer is: c
  • Women’s Heptathlon includes:
    • 100m hurdles, high jump, shot put, 200m run, long jump, javelin throw, 800m run
  • Discus throw: Included in Pentathlon, not Heptathlon
  • Heptathlon is a women's competition that includes seven sports: 100 meter hurdles, high jump, shot put, 200 meter run, long jump, 800 meter run, and javelin throw.
  • Pentathlon is a one-day competition that consists of five sports: high jump, javelin throw, 200 meter race, discus throw, and 1500 meter race, organized in that order.
  • The steeplechase is a race of 3000 meters that features obstacles in the form of hurdles and water. It is also known as walking.
  • Shot Put involves athletes throwing a metal ball into the air.
  • In Pole Vault, athletes use a thin pole to jump over a bar and fall onto a mattress placed on the ground.
  • Discus Throw consists of athletes throwing a saucer-shaped discus with one hand after rotating one and a half revolutions.
  • Decathlon is a men's competition that includes ten sports: 100 meters, 400 meters, 1500 meters race, high jump, long jump, shot put, 110 meters hurdles, discus throw, pole vault, and javelin throw. It lasts for two days.
